intro: Terebinthus longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed terebinth, is a member of the Burseraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces fragrant, resinous sap that has been historically used in traditional medicine. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it distinct within its genus, with unique adaptations to its arid environment.
